item.title: My Janet Story | Jungle Coder
item.description: Since Advent of Code in 2020, I’ve been doing 95% of my hobby programming in a language called Janet, which not even I woud have predicted before that. I’d just broken my “heavily multithreaded or bust” phase by using Ruby for a few things, after having been big on Nim, which I gave up because of not feeling at home in the web-development frameworks it has. Both are fine languages in their own right, but where not where my brain wanted to be. Then, I thought I’d give Janet a try during AoC 2020. I’d tried lisps in the past. (And yes, despite what the Common Lisp community has to say, Janet is a lisp, even if it’s not a Lisp), but none of them ever quite stuck for me.

item.title: I changed my mind about Tailwind CSS
item.description: I thought semantic classnames and BEM were the way to go. I didn't even bother experimenting with Tailwind CSS. Nowadays, I'm very happy that it's part of my workflow.

item.title: Thumby - The Tiny Playable Keychain
item.description: TinyCircuits is launching Thumby, the world's tiniest playable keychain. It's '90s, it comes with 5 retro games, and it's programmable. Thumby is a miniature, cute, fun, powerful accessory. It's a great gift to decorate your bag and gives surprise and joy. Launching on Kickstarter September 28th, 2021.

item.description: The release candidate of Npgsql Entity Framework Core provider version 6.0 has been released and is available on nuget. This version works with version 6.0 of Entity Framework Core, and brings new Npgsql features in addition to the general EF Core changes.

item.title: The case of the UWP application that crashes at launch on Windows 10X
item.description: Application compatibility testing for Windows 10X identified a program that crashed at launch. We were able to obtain a time travel trace for the application.
